spdfcore.stanalys

Class ParamComm

  • java.lang.Object
    • spdfcore.stanalys.ParamComm

  • public final class ParamComm
extends java.lang.Object
    "Parameter Communication" class manages parameter sources and users. You can find all sources and all users and bind them to each other by edges that model parameter communication. The sources of parameters are modifiers, which delegate their job to "period actors".

    • Method Detail

      • setGraph

        public void setGraph(Graph graph)
        set the graph to be managed by this ParamComm object

      • getPeriodActor

        public Actor getPeriodActor(java.lang.String parameter)
        get period actor for the parameter. If it does not exist (e.g. environment parameter) then return null

      • getUserSet

        public java.util.HashSet<Actor> getUserSet(java.lang.String parameter)
        get the user actors for the parameter. by convention, the modifier of a parameter can still be its user, we do not exclude the modifiers from the set of users if they use the parameter.

      • getUsedParameterSet

        public java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> getUsedParameterSet(Actor actor)
        get the set of parameters used by the actor by convention, a parameter modified by an actor can be also a parameter used, we do not exclude the parameters modified from the set of parameter used.

      • getModifiedParameterSet

        public java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> getModifiedParameterSet(Actor actor)
        get the parameters modified by the given actor

      • getModifiedParameters

        public java.util.Iterator<java.lang.String> getModifiedParameters()
        get all the modified parameters

      • getEnvironmentParameters

        java.util.Iterator<java.lang.String> getEnvironmentParameters()
        Environment parameters are those that are not modified by an actor. Those are assumed to be (unknown) constants, provided at run-time at the start of execution for the whole life cycle of the graph.

      • isPeriodActor

        public boolean isPeriodActor(Actor actor)
        Checks wether given actor is a period actor

      • insertPeriodActors

        public void insertPeriodActors()
        One basic step of the analysis flow: insert the graph nodes called "period actors" (also known as `emitters'). We connect every period actor to the corresponding modifier. A "period actor" is a purely analytical node that fires at each modification period.

      • identifyParameterSources

        public void identifyParameterSources(GraphExpressions expressions)
        Look which parameters are being used by each actor and identify the source of each parameter. If parameter is modified by an actor, then the "source" is the associated period actor. Otherwise the parameter is supposed to be provided by graph environment, and is not modified during the execution.

      • establishUniquePeriodActors

        private void establishUniquePeriodActors()
        Check whether all the modified parameters have have a unique instance of modifier. Every modifier instance corresponds to one period actor.

      • identifyParameterUsers

        public void identifyParameterUsers(GraphExpressions expressions,
                          Solutions solutions)
        Find the user actors for every parameter.
        Parameters:
        expressions - - all rates
        solutions - - solutions of balance equations

      • addUser

        private void addUser(java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String> parameterSet,
           Actor actor)
        register an actor as user of the given set of parameters
        Parameters:
        parameterSet -
        actor -

      • connectSourcesToUsers

        public void connectSourcesToUsers(Solutions solutions)
        Connect the period nodes to the users to model the propagation of parameters to the users at every period. Note that this should be done after a successful safety check, otherwise this step will not succeed or a later safety check may say "unsafe".
        Parameters:
        solutions - - solutions of balance equations
